title: Introduction to Media and Information Literacy
description: Learn the basics of media literacy, including how to critically assess information, identify misinformation, and navigate digital spaces responsibly.

title: Fact-Checking Fundamentals
description: Discover tools and strategies for verifying the credibility of news and media sources, ensuring the accuracy of shared information.

title: AI in Media: Opportunities and Challenges
description: Explore the role of Artificial Intelligence in media, from content creation to misinformation detection, and understand its ethical implications.

title: Understanding Media Bias
description: Learn how to recognize media bias in various news outlets and understand its impact on public perception and critical thinking.

title: Digital Storytelling for Youth
description: A practical course on using digital tools to create compelling and ethical stories that highlight key social issues and digital literacy.

title: Cybersecurity Essentials for Digital Citizens
description: Gain essential knowledge about protecting personal information online, including password safety, privacy, and recognizing phishing attempts.

title: Effective Online Research Techniques
description: Learn how to find reliable sources of information online, avoid misinformation, and improve your research skills for media and academic purposes.

title: Youth Activism in the Digital Age
description: Understand the power of digital activism and how youth can drive social change through online campaigns and responsible media usage.

title: Digital Etiquette and Ethical Communication
description: Master the art of respectful and effective communication in digital spaces, from social media to professional interactions.

title: Building Positive Online Communities
description: Explore how to foster inclusivity, support, and positive engagement in online communities, ensuring they are safe and welcoming for all.
